alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Lamar; Marion; Walker; Winston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 1:19PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Walker, southern Marion, southern Winston, northern Fayette and northeastern Lamar Counties through 200 PM CDT... At 119 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Smith Dam to 6 miles north of Beaverton. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jasper, Hamilton, Winfield, Sumiton, Cordova, Dora, Carbon Hill, Sulligent, Lynn, Arley, Guin, Parrish, Brilliant, Oakman, Glen Allen, Sipsey, Kansas, Nauvoo, Beaverton and Gu-Win. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
